alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued February 17 at 7:16AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Hatcher Pass Avalanche Center. ...THE HATCHER PASS AVALANCHE CENTER HAS ISSUED AN AVALANCHE WARNING... * WHAT...The avalanche danger is high. Very dangerous avalanche conditions exist. Travel in avalanche terrain is NOT recommended. * WHERE...Skeetak (mile 11) to Independence Mine, including Gold Mint and Archangel Valley. * WHEN...In effect from Thursday 700 AM AKST to Friday 700 AM AKST. * IMPACTS...Over 20 inches of snow and 3.3 inches water have accumulated over the past 3 days. An additional 12 to 18 inches of snow and 2 inches or more water are expected through Friday morning. Large to very large human triggered avalanches are very likely and natural avalanches are likely on slopes steeper than 30 degrees. Debris from avalanches above may run across the road and into valley bottoms. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Backcountry travelers should stay off of...and out from underneath...slopes steeper than 30 degrees. Avalanches may run long distances. Avoid avalanche terrain. Consult http://www.hpavalanche.org or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. The Hatcher Pass Road will be closed at mile 11 through the weekend due to avalanche activity.
